humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor, which is 1.7 cm. According to the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size. Since the tumor size is less than 2 cm but greater than 1 cm, it falls under the T1c category. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T1c.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for this patient is T1c, which is determined by the maximum dimension of the invasive component of the tumor. In this report, the invasive tumor measures 1.7 cm in greatest dimension (Slide 1E), and is therefore classified as T1c.
